column5: Looking for tires for my Jeep Compass -  215/60/R17 - all season or advice  .  . . Installed.  I'm in Woodbridge. Will travel an hour or so away. I've seen posts over the years . . .  Thanks   A
Al, cheapest thing to do is drive over to Buffalo, get new tires installed and drive back.  Even with the price of the trip, it will be lower then buying them over here.
Yep. If not try costco

Thanks B, I was close last week visiting fishing buddies and after I walked through FDRs garden in Ridgeway my  thoughts were there as I looked over Lake Erie. But if 'she' finds out then it will cost me more "can I come shopping"  . .  .
Ahhh..... then the trip costs increase!  LOL!
I got a set installed by ecmilley. Great guy, good price, and we shot the bull while he did it.  S.

check costco or the paper for any current deals  i know firestone had a decent deal on their tires recently, maybe it is still going on.   i am real happy with my destination A/T tires.  the destinations are well rated and come in a H/T tire as well.

My son bought four tires for his Compass at Costco earlier this year. They were Bridgestone Turanzas 215/60R17, and he paid $659.00 installed and after a rebate of $79.10 the total cost was $580.05. He's very satisfied.
I know this is ODD but Ford's running ads right now as the best price tire guys.  if not costco for sure.  I can check with steelcase tire n' mag too if you want Al.  Woodbind and Steels area.
thanks G, I'm just a round the corner from them at work may drop in.
Talk to Jimmy or Davy and I'll PM ya the rest...

Agree with buffalo, But if you want to try local, check out joycitytires.com He has a cash price and will quote via email.  Just send a request with your size, and he will get back to you pretty quickly.  He put a set of Yokohama Avid Envigors on my Subaru for $600 ( they lasted 65km before a guy tee boned me as he ran a red). They were 205/55/16's. Saved me a few pennies from Going to Costco plus I got the mail in rebate at the time
Is it a parts car now?  I have a Subaru and can use some new wheels come spring time (got 2 sets; summer and snow's now)  I need a new set for 'summer'

visit tirerack . com shop for tires by brand, size, rating, price, etc or use their "survey results" link on the left of the homepage select the tire you want have the tires delivered to a preferred installer in the US drive down and have them installed cheaper than here drive home with a big smile knowing you saved a huge chunk of cash   we're making the trip in two weeks for pirelli tires and 4 monroe quick struts for the car. we'll be getting everything for $100 LESS than what the struts alone would cost at canadian tire. i'm all for supporting our country, but that's complete Bull.
Tire prices are completely off the charts down in the US compared to up here.

Here's what Sam's Club has to offer........ http://www.samsclub.com/sams/search/searchResults.jsp?searchCategoryId=all&compareProducts=true&tireSearch=null&servDesc=95T,96H,96T&rootDimension=null&noOfRecordsPerPage=80&altQuery=null&searchTerm=2156017&_requestid=206370  Also if you come down here, you could try Dunn Tire...  http://www.dunntire.com/

I’m in London and not sure if this is worth your while; but I can sell you a Dunlop Signature II all-season for $150.00 each, installed & balanced? Plus applicable taxes (OTS & HST) of course. They’re advertized as having a 105,000klm warrantee; I’ve sold a bunch of them with no complaints.  Dan.
You can try John at Bramalea Tire 905 793-1881, tell him Gord at Schaefer mentioned him!  I have never seen better pricing locally.

Thanks Gord (and  the rest of OFNrs)  we had a chat this afternoon, He was very reasonable. I have never bought a full set of tires before and a long time since I actually priced tires and have been out of touch in pricing.  In will follow up with him for now, but I have emailed other contacts that other members have put forward in this thread. all of you have been most helpful, thank you.  Any typography problems I'm here!

Simply Tire (Keele/Finch) Automotive Import Market/ A.I.M (Woodbine/Denison) Wheels Direct (McCowan/Sheppard) Tires23 (Dixie/Matheson) Tire World (Steeles/Torbram)  I can vouch for all of them and you will find their pricing very competitive. Good luck
you might want to get into a group guy that simply tire is hosting right now, those guys have great product knowledge and service.
